Class Merge3

Direct Known Subclasses:
IntroMerge3
public class Merge3 extends Merge
Merge3 Sort the sorting process is divided into three parts and performed incrementally. The idea behind this approach is to split the input array into three roughly equal parts and recursively sort each part separately. Then, the sorted parts are merged together to obtain the final sorted array.
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Merge3

      public Merge3()
      Merge3 Sort:
      The sorting process is divided into three parts and performed incrementally. The idea behind this approach is to split the input array into three roughly equal parts and recursively sort each part separately. Then, the sorted parts are merged together to obtain the final sorted array.

      Example:
      1. Divide the input range into three parts by calculating two midpoints. These midpoints split the range into three roughly equal parts.
      2. Recursively sort each part using. This method is called four times to sort the left, middle, and right parts of the range, as well as to merge the sorted parts together.
      3. The performs the actual sorting and merging operations. completes, the sorted elements are stored in a temporary buffer array. Finally, the sorted elements are copied back from the buffer array to the original array.
      Note:
      Merge3 Sort customized or adapted version of merge sort with sorting and merging steps. Property:
      Worst Case Complexity: O(n^2)
      Best Case Complexity: O(n log(n))
      Average Case Complexity: O(n log(n))
      Auxiliary Space: O(n)
      Stability: Yes
      See Also:
      • IntroDPQMerge3
      • IntroMerge3

    • merge3Inc

      protected void merge3Inc(Comparable[] array)
      merge3Inc the method, a new temporary array called buffer is created with the same length as the input array. The System.arraycopy method is used to copy the elements from the input array into the buffer array.
      • Is called with the buffer array as the temporary storage. This method will recursively sort the specified range (0 to array.length) using the buffer array.
      • After the mergeInc method completes, the sorted elements are stored in the buffer array. Finally, the sorted elements are copied back from the buffer array to the original array using another System.arraycopy call.
      merge3Inc method serves as a wrapper for the mergeInc method, providing the necessary setup and cleanup steps for the incremental merge sort algorithm.
      Parameters:
      array - The array to be sorted.
      See Also:
      • mergeInc(Comparable[], int, int, Comparable[])

      • After the mergeDec method completes, the sorted elements are stored in the buffer array. Finally, the sorted elements are copied back from the buffer array to the original array using another System.arraycopy call.

    • merge3Inc

      protected void merge3Inc(Comparable[] array, int left, int right)
      merge3Inc the method, a new temporary array called buffer is created with the same length as the input array. The System.arraycopy method is used to copy the elements from the input array into the buffer array.
      • Is called with the buffer array as the temporary storage. This method will recursively sort the specified range (left to right) using the buffer array.
      • After the mergeInc method completes, the sorted elements are stored in the buffer array. Finally, the sorted elements are copied back from the buffer array to the original array using another System.arraycopy call.
      merge3Inc method serves as a wrapper for the mergeInc method, providing the necessary setup and cleanup steps for the incremental merge sort algorithm.
      Parameters:
      array - The array to be sorted.
      left - indices representing the range of elements to be sorted.
      right - indices representing the range of elements to be sorted.

      protected void merge3Dec(Comparable[] array, int left, int right)

      • Is called with the buffer array as the temporary storage. This method will recursively sort the specified range (left to right) using the buffer array.
      • After the mergeDec method completes, the sorted elements are stored in the buffer array. Finally, the sorted elements are copied back from the buffer array to the original array using another System.arraycopy call.
      merge3Dec method serves as a wrapper for the mergeDec method, providing the necessary setup and cleanup steps for the decremental merge sort algorithm.

    • mergeInc

      public void mergeInc(Comparable[] array, int left, int right, Comparable[] buffer)
      mergeInc method for performing an iterative bottom-up merge sort on an array. It divides the array into subarrays of increasing sizesand merges them together until the entire array is sorted.
      • first conditional statement (right - left) < 2 checks if the current range has less than two elements. If true, it means the range is already sorted, so the method returns without performing any further operations.
      • Next, the method calculates two midpoints: mid1 and mid2. These midpoints divide the current range into three roughly equal parts.
      • It recursively sorts the left / mid / right part of the range from left to mid1 /mid1 to mid2 / mid2 to right using the buffer array as the temporary storage.
      • Call method mergeInc. mergeInc method for merging three sorted subarrays into a single array. It takes the indices of the subarray boundaries and uses four pointers left, mid1, mid2, right, to iterate through the subarrays and merge them into a buffer array.
      mergeInc The recursive calls ensure that the algorithm recursively divides the input array into smaller parts until each part has less than two elements, and then merges the sorted parts together to obtain the final sorted array.
      Parameters:
      array - The array to be sorted.
      left - The starting index of the subarray to be sorted.
      right - The ending index (exclusive) of the subarray to be sorted.
      buffer - An auxiliary array used for merging.
      See Also:
      • MergeInterface.mergeInc(Comparable[], int, int, int, int, Comparable[])

    • mergeDec

      public void mergeDec(Comparable[] array, int left, int right, Comparable[] buffer)
      mergeDec method for performing an iterative bottom-up merge sort on an array. It divides the array into subarrays of decreasing sizesand merges them together until the entire array is sorted.
      • first conditional statement (right - left) < 2 checks if the current range has less than two elements. If true, it means the range is already sorted, so the method returns without performing any further operations.
      • Next, the method calculates two midpoints: mid1 and mid2. These midpoints divide the current range into three roughly equal parts.
      • It recursively sorts the left / mid / right part of the range from left to mid1 /mid1 to mid2 / mid2 to right using the buffer array as the temporary storage.
      • Call method mergeInc. mergeInc method for merging three sorted subarrays into a single array. It takes the indices of the subarray boundaries and uses four pointers left, mid1, mid2, right, to iterate through the subarrays and merge them into a buffer array.
      mergeDec The recursive calls ensure that the algorithm recursively divides the input array into smaller parts until each part has less than two elements, and then merges the sorted parts together to obtain the final sorted array.
      Parameters:
      array - The array to be sorted.
      left - The starting index of the subarray to be sorted.
      right - The ending index (exclusive) of the subarray to be sorted.
      buffer - An auxiliary array used for merging.
      See Also:
      • MergeInterface.mergeDec(Comparable[], int, int, int, int, Comparable[])
